completionNotification.mdDescription:
Notification behavior when this agent completes a task. If not set, the global default notification setting will be used.
                - `os-notification`: Show OS/system notifications
                - `message`: Show notifications in the status bar/message area
                - `blink`: Blink or highlight the UI
                - `off`: Disable notifications for this agent
completionNotification.title: Completion Notification

defaultAgent.description: Optional: <agent-name> of the Chat Agent that shall be invoked, if no agent is explicitly mentioned with @<agent-name> in the user query. If no Default Agent is configured, Theia´s defaults will be applied.

pinChatAgent.description: Enable agent pinning to automatically keep a mentioned chat agent active across prompts, reducing the need for repeated mentions.You can manually unpin or switch agents anytime.

confirm.description: Ask for confirmation before executing tools

agent.description: This agent provides inline code completion in the code editor in the Theia IDE.

automaticEnable.description:
Automatically trigger AI completions inline within any (Monaco) editor while editing.            
            Alternatively, you can manually trigger the code via the command "Trigger Inline Suggestion" or the default shortcut "Ctrl+Alt+Space".

cacheCapacity.description: Maximum number of code completions to store in the cache. A higher number can improve performance but will consume more memory.                Minimum value is 10, recommended range is between 50-200.
cacheCapacity.title: Code Completion Cache Capacity

debounceDelay.description: Controls the delay in milliseconds before triggering AI completions after changes have been detected in the editor.                Requires `Automatic Code Completion` to be enabled. Enter 0 to disable the debounce delay.
debounceDelay.title: Debounce Delay

excludedFileExts.description: Specify file extensions (e.g., .md, .txt) where AI completions should be disabled.
excludedFileExts.title: Excluded File Extensions

maxContextLines.description: The maximum number of lines used as context, distributed among the lines before and after the cursor position (prefix and suffix).            Set this to -1 to use the full file as context without any line limit and 0 to only use the current line.
maxContextLines.title: Maximum Context Lines

stripBackticks.description: Remove surrounding backticks from the code returned by some LLMs. If a backtick is detected, all content after the closing             backtick is stripped as well. This setting helps ensure plain code is returned when language models use markdown-like formatting.
stripBackticks.title: Strip Backticks from Inline Completions

changeSetSummaryVariable.description: Provides a summary of the files in a change set and their contents.

defaultNotification.mdDescription:
The default notification method used when an AI agent completes a task. Individual agents can override this setting.
                - `os-notification`: Show OS/system notifications
                - `message`: Show notifications in the status bar/message area
                - `blink`: Blink or highlight the UI
                - `off`: Disable all notifications
defaultNotification.title: Default Notification Type

enableAI.mdDescription:
❗ This setting allows you to access the latest AI capabilities (Alpha version).            
            Please note that these features are in an alpha phase, which means they may             undergo changes and will be further improved. It is important to be aware that these features may generate            continuous requests to the language models (LLMs) you provide access to. This might incur costs that you            need to monitor closely. By enabling this option, you acknowledge these risks.            
            **Please note! The settings below in this section will only take effect
            once the main feature setting is enabled. After enabling the feature, you need to configure at least one            LLM provider below. Also see [the documentation](https://theia-ide.org/docs/user_ai/)**.

maxRetries.mdDescription: The maximum number of retry attempts when a request to an AI provider fails. A value of 0 means no retries.
maxRetries.title: Maximum Retries

openEditorsShortVariable.description: Short reference to all currently open files (relative paths, comma-separated)

openEditorsVariable.description: A comma-separated list of all currently open files, relative to the workspace root.

promptFragmentsConfiguration.label: Prompt Fragments
promptFragmentsConfiguration.removeCustomizationDialogMsg: Are you sure you want to remove the {0} customization for prompt fragment "{1}"?
promptFragmentsConfiguration.removeCustomizationWithDescDialogMsg: Are you sure you want to remove the {0} customization for prompt fragment "{1}" ({2})?
promptFragmentsConfiguration.resetAllCustomizationsDialogMsg: Are you sure you want to reset all prompt fragments to their built-in versions? This will remove all customizations.
promptFragmentsConfiguration.resetToBuiltInDialogMsg: Are you sure you want to reset the prompt fragment "{0}" to its built-in version? This will remove all customizations.
promptFragmentsConfiguration.resetToCustomizationDialogMsg: Are you sure you want to reset the prompt fragment "{0}" to use the {1} customization? This will remove all higher-priority customizations.
promptFragmentsConfiguration.variantsOfSystemPrompt: Variants of this prompt variant set:

promptTemplates.description: Folder for storing customized prompt templates. If not customized the user config directory is used. Please consider to use a folder, which is            under version control to manage your variants of prompt templates.

requestSettings.mdDescription:
Allows specifying custom request settings for multiple models.
            Each setting consists of:
            - `scope`: Defines when the setting applies:
              - `modelId` (optional): The model ID to match
              - `providerId` (optional): The provider ID to match (e.g., huggingface, openai, ollama, llamafile)
              - `agentId` (optional): The agent ID to match
            - `requestSettings`: Model-specific settings as key-value pairs
            - `clientSettings`: Client-side message handling settings:
              - `keepToolCalls` (boolean): Whether to keep tool calls in the context
              - `keepThinking` (boolean): Whether to keep thinking messages
            Settings are matched based on specificity (agent: 100, model: 10, provider: 1 points).
            Refer to [our documentation](https://theia-ide.org/docs/user_ai/#custom-request-settings) for more information.
requestSettings.title: Custom Request Settings

taskContextSummary.description: Resolves all task context items present in the session context.

templateSettings.unavailableVariant: Selected variant not available, default will be used

variable-contribution.currentAbsoluteFilePath: The absolute path of the                 currently opened file. Please note that most agents will expect a relative file path (relative to the current workspace).
variable-contribution.currentFileContent: The plain content of the                 currently opened file. This excludes the information where the content is coming from. Please note that most agents will work better with a relative file path                 (relative to the current workspace).
variable-contribution.currentRelativeDirPath: The relative path of the directory                 containing the currently opened file.
variable-contribution.currentRelativeFilePath: The relative path of the                 currently opened file.
variable-contribution.currentSelectedText: The plain text that is currently selected in the                 opened file. This excludes the information where the content is coming from. Please note that most agents will work better with a relative file path                 (relative to the current workspace).
variable-contribution.dotRelativePath: Short reference to the relative path of the                 currently opened file ('currentRelativeFilePath').

apiKey.description: Enter an API Key of your official Google AI (Gemini) Account. **Please note:** By using this preference the GOOGLE AI API key will be stored in clear text            on the machine running Theia. Use the environment variable `GOOGLE_API_KEY` to set the key securely.

maxRetriesOnErrors.description: Maximum number of retries in case of errors. If smaller than 1, then the retry logic is disabled

models.description: Official Google Gemini models to use

retryDelayOnOtherErrors.description: Delay in seconds between retries in case of other errors (sometimes the Google GenAI reports errors such as incomplete JSON syntax returned from the model                 or 500 Internal Server Error). Setting this to -1 prevents retries in these cases. Otherwise a retry happens either immediately (if set to 0) or after                 this delay in seconds (if set to a positive number).

retryDelayOnRateLimitError.description: Delay in seconds between retries in case of rate limit errors. See https://ai.google.dev/gemini-api/docs/rate-limits

ide.prompt-template-description: Select prompt variants and customize prompt templates for AI agents in the [AI Configuration View]({0}).

prefs.mdDescription:
This setting allows you to configure and manage LlamaFile models in Theia IDE.            
            Each entry requires a user-friendly `name`, the file `uri` pointing to your LlamaFile, and the `port` on which it will run.            
            To start a LlamaFile, use the "Start LlamaFile" command, which enables you to select the desired model.            
            If you edit an entry (e.g., change the port), any running instance will stop, and you will need to manually start it again.            
            [Learn more about configuring and managing LlamaFiles in the Theia IDE documentation](https://theia-ide.org/docs/user_ai/#llamafile-models).

name.description: The model name to use for this Llamafile.

port.description: The port to use to start the server.

prefs.title: ✨ AI LlamaFile

uri.description: The file uri to the Llamafile.

Something went wrong during the llamafile start: {0}.
For more information, see the console.

Something went wrong during the llamafile stop: {0}.
For more information, see the console.

apiKey.mdDescription: Enter an API Key of your official OpenAI Account. **Please note:** By using this preference the Open AI API key will be stored in clear text on the machine running Theia. Use the environment variable `OPENAI_API_KEY` to set the key securely.

apiKey.title: Either the key to access the API served at the given url or `true` to use the global OpenAI API key

apiVersion.title: Either the version to access the API served at the given url in Azure or `true` to use the global OpenAI API version

developerMessageSettings.title: Controls the handling of system messages: `user`, `system`, and `developer` will be used as a role, `mergeWithFollowingUserMessage` will prefix                         the following user message with the system message or convert the system message to user message if the next message is not a user message.                         `skip` will just remove the system message), defaulting to `developer`.

enableStreaming.title: Indicates whether the streaming API shall be used. `true` by default.

id.title: A unique identifier which is used in the UI to identify the custom model

customEndpoints.mdDescription:
Integrate custom models compatible with the OpenAI API, for example via `vllm`. The required attributes are `model` and `url`.            
            Optionally, you can            
            - specify a unique `id` to identify the custom model in the UI. If none is given `model` will be used as `id`.            
            - provide an `apiKey` to access the API served at the given url. Use `true` to indicate the use of the global OpenAI API key.            
            - provide an `apiVersion` to access the API served at the given url in Azure. Use `true` to indicate the use of the global OpenAI API version.            
            - set `developerMessageSettings` to one of `user`, `system`, `developer`, `mergeWithFollowingUserMessage`, or `skip` to control how the developer message is            included (where `user`, `system`, and `developer` will be used as a role, `mergeWithFollowingUserMessage` will prefix the following user message with the system            message or convert the system message to user message if the next message is not a user message. `skip` will just remove the system message).            Defaulting to `developer`.            
            - specify `supportsStructuredOutput: false` to indicate that structured output shall not be used.            
            - specify `enableStreaming: false` to indicate that streaming shall not be used.            
            Refer to [our documentation](https://theia-ide.org/docs/user_ai/#openai-compatible-models-eg-via-vllm) for more information.

supportsStructuredOutput.title: Indicates whether the model supports structured output. `true` by default.

url.title: The Open AI API compatible endpoint where the model is hosted

extensions.description: List of additional file extensions in prompt locations that are considered as prompt templates. '.prompttemplate' is always considered as a default.
extensions.title: Additional Prompt Template File Extensions

automatic.description: Enable automatic scan of code snippets in chat views.

mode.description:
Configure the SCANOSS feature for analyzing code snippets in chat views. This will send a hash of suggested code snippets to the SCANOSS
service hosted by the [Software Transparency foundation](https://www.softwaretransparency.org/osskb) for analysis.

manual.description: User can manually trigger the scan by clicking the SCANOSS item in the chat view.

agent.description: This agent provides assistance to write and execute arbitrary terminal commands.         Based on the user's request, it suggests commands and allows the user to directly paste and execute them in the terminal.         It accesses the current directory, environment and the recent terminal output of the terminal session to provide context-aware assistance

tokenUsage.noData: No token usage data available yet.
tokenUsage.note: Token usage is tracked since the start of the application and is not persisted.
tokenUsage.readCachedInputTokensTooltip: Tracked additionally to 'Input Token'. Usually much less expensive than not cached. Usually does not count to rate limits.
tokenUsage.title: AI Model Token Usage

apiKey.title: Either the key to access the API served at the given url or `true` to use the global API key

enableStreaming.title: Indicates whether the streaming API shall be used. `true` by default.

id.title: A unique identifier which is used in the UI to identify the custom model

customEndpoints.mdDescription:
Integrate custom models compatible with the Vercel AI SDK. The required attributes are `model` and `url`.            
            Optionally, you can            
            - specify a unique `id` to identify the custom model in the UI. If none is given `model` will be used as `id`.            
            - provide an `apiKey` to access the API served at the given url. Use `true` to indicate the use of the global API key.            
            - specify `supportsStructuredOutput: false` to indicate that structured output shall not be used.            
            - specify `enableStreaming: false` to indicate that streaming shall not be used.            
            - specify `provider` to indicate which provider the model is from (openai, anthropic).

supportsStructuredOutput.title: Indicates whether the model supports structured output. `true` by default.

url.title: The API endpoint where the model is hosted

models.description: Official models to use with Vercel AI SDK

openaiApiKey.mdDescription: Enter an API Key for OpenAI models used by the Vercel AI SDK.                 **Please note:** By using this preference the API key will be stored in clear text on the machine running Theia. Use the environment variable `OPENAI_API_KEY` to set the key securely.

coderAgent.description: An AI assistant integrated into Theia IDE, designed to assist software developers. This agent can access the users workspace, it can get a list of all available files         and folders and retrieve their content. Furthermore, it can suggest modifications of files to the user. It can therefore assist the user with coding tasks or other         tasks involving file changes.

considerGitignore.description: If enabled, excludes files/folders specified in a global .gitignore file (expected location is the workspace root).
considerGitignore.title: Consider .gitignore

excludedPattern.description: List of patterns (glob or regex) for files/folders to exclude.
excludedPattern.title: Excluded File Patterns

searchMaxResults.description: Maximum number of search results returned by the workspace search function.
searchMaxResults.title: Maximum Search Results

workspaceAgent.description: An AI assistant integrated into Theia IDE, designed to assist software developers. This agent can access the users workspace, it can get a list of all available files          and folders and retrieve their content. It cannot modify files. It can therefore answer questions about the current project, project files and source code in the          workspace, such as how to build the project, where to put source code, where to find specific code or configurations, etc.

tabCloseIconPlacement.description: Place the close icons on tab titles at the start or end of the tab. The default is end on all platforms.
tabCloseIconPlacement.end: Place the close icon at the end of the label. In left-to-right languages, this is the right side of the tab.
tabCloseIconPlacement.start: Place the close icon at the start of the label. In left-to-right languages, this is the left side of the tab.

editor.diffEditor.wordWrap2: Lines will wrap according to the `#editor.wordWrap#` setting.
editor.dirtyEncoding: The file is dirty. Please save it first before reopening it with another encoding.
editor.editor.bracketPairColorization.enabled: Controls whether bracket pair colorization is enabled or not. Use `#workbench.colorCustomizations#` to override the bracket highlight colors.
editor.editor.codeActions.triggerOnFocusChange: Enable triggering `#editor.codeActionsOnSave#` when `#files.autoSave#` is set to `afterDelay`. Code Actions must be set to `always` to be triggered for window and focus changes.
editor.editor.detectIndentation: Controls whether `#editor.tabSize#` and `#editor.insertSpaces#` will be automatically detected when a file is opened based on the file contents.
editor.editor.inlayHints.enabled1: Inlay hints are showing by default and hide when holding Ctrl+Alt
editor.editor.inlayHints.enabled2: Inlay hints are hidden by default and show when holding Ctrl+Alt
editor.editor.inlayHints.fontFamily: Controls font family of inlay hints in the editor. When set to empty, the `#editor.fontFamily#` is used.
editor.editor.inlayHints.fontSize: Controls font size of inlay hints in the editor. As default the `#editor.fontSize#` is used when the configured value is less than `5` or greater than the editor font size.
Controls whether to enable experimental edits in inline suggestions.
Controls whether to only show inline suggestions when the cursor is close to the suggestion.
Controls whether to enable experimental interleaved lines diff in inline suggestions.
Controls whether to enable experimental edits in inline suggestions.
editor.editor.insertSpaces: Insert spaces when pressing `Tab`. This setting is overridden based on the file contents when `#editor.detectIndentation#` is on.
editor.editor.quickSuggestions: Controls whether suggestions should automatically show up while typing. This can be controlled for typing in comments, strings, and other code. Quick suggestion can be configured to show as ghost text or with the suggest widget. Also be aware of the `#editor.suggestOnTriggerCharacters#`-setting which controls if suggestions are triggered by special characters.
editor.editor.suggestFontSize: Font size for the suggest widget. When set to `0`, the value of `#editor.fontSize#` is used.
editor.editor.suggestLineHeight: Line height for the suggest widget. When set to `0`, the value of `#editor.lineHeight#` is used. The minimum value is 8.
editor.editor.tabSize: The number of spaces a tab is equal to. This setting is overridden based on the file contents when `#editor.detectIndentation#` is on.
editor.formatOnSaveTimeout: Timeout in milliseconds after which the formatting that is run on file save is cancelled.
editor.persistClosedEditors: Controls whether to persist closed editor history for the workspace across window reloads.

plugin-dev.preventedNewTab: Your browser prevented opening of a new tab
plugin-dev.watchMode: Run watcher on plugin under development

plugin-ext.webviewWarnIfUnsecure: Warns users that webviews are currently deployed unsecurely.

preview.openByDefault: Open the preview instead of the editor by default.

dev-container.noDevcontainerFiles: No devcontainer.json files found in the workspace. Please ensure you have a .devcontainer directory with a devcontainer.json file.

remote.nodeDownloadTemplate: Controls the template used to download the node.js binaries for the remote backend. Points to the official node.js website by default. Uses multiple placeholders:
remote.nodeDownloadTemplateExt: `{ext}` for the file extension. Either `zip`, `tar.xz` or `tar.xz`, depending on the operating system.
remote.nodeDownloadTemplateOS: `{os}` for the remote operating system. Either `win`, `linux` or `darwin`.

ssh.connectToConfigHost: Connect Current Window to Host in Config File...
ssh.failure: Could not open SSH connection to remote.

wsl.noWslDistroFound: No WSL distributions found. Please install a WSL distribution first.

search-in-workspace.noFolderSpecified: You have not opened or specified a folder. Only open files are currently searched.
search-in-workspace.resultSubset: This is only a subset of all results. Use a more specific search term to narrow down the result list.
search-in-workspace.searchOnEditorModification: Search the active editor when modified.

task.noTaskToRun: No task to run found. Configure Tasks...

terminal.enableCopy: Enable ctrl-c (cmd-c on macOS) to copy selected text
terminal.enablePaste: Enable ctrl-v (cmd-v on macOS) to paste from clipboard
terminal.profileArgs: The shell arguments that this profile uses.
terminal.profileColor: A terminal theme color ID to associate with the terminal.
terminal.profileIcon:
A codicon ID to associate with the terminal icon.
terminal-tmux:"$(terminal-tmux)"
terminal.profilePath: The path of the shell that this profile uses.
terminal.profiles:
The profiles to present when creating a new terminal. Set the path property manually with optional args.
Set an existing profile to `null` to hide the profile from the list, for example: `"{0}": null`.
terminal.rendererType: Controls how the terminal is rendered.
terminal.rendererTypeDeprecationMessage: The renderer type is no longer supported as an option.
terminal.selectProfile: Select a profile for the new terminal
terminal.shell.deprecated: This is deprecated, the new recommended way to configure your default shell is by creating a terminal profile in 'terminal.integrated.profiles.{0}' and setting its profile name as the default in 'terminal.integrated.defaultProfile.{0}.'
terminal.shellArgsLinux: The command line arguments to use when on the Linux terminal.
terminal.shellArgsOsx: The command line arguments to use when on the macOS terminal.
terminal.shellArgsWindows: The command line arguments to use when on the Windows terminal.
terminal.shellLinux: The path of the shell that the terminal uses on Linux (default: '{0}'}).
terminal.shellOsx: The path of the shell that the terminal uses on macOS (default: '{0}'}).
terminal.shellWindows: The path of the shell that the terminal uses on Windows. (default: '{0}').

toolbar.addCommandPlaceholder: Find a command to add to the toolbar
toolbar.failedUpdate: Failed to update the value of '{0}' in '{1}'.
toolbar.toolbarLocationPlaceholder: Where would you like the command added?

vsx-registry.confirmDialogMessage: The extension "{0}" is unverified and might pose a security risk.
vsx-registry.confirmDialogTitle: Are you sure you want to proceed with the installation?
vsx-registry.errorFetchingConfigurationHint: This could be caused by network configuration issues.
vsx-registry.invalidVSIX: The selected file is not a valid "*.vsix" plugin.
vsx-registry.onlyShowVerifiedExtensionsDescription: This allows the {0} to only show verified extensions.
vsx-registry.recommendedExtensions: Do you want to install the recommended extensions for this repository?
vsx-registry.showRecommendedExtensions: Controls whether notifications are shown for extension recommendations.

webview.messageWarning: The {0} endpoint's host pattern has been changed to `{1}`; changing the pattern can lead to security vulnerabilities.             See `{2}` for more information.

workspace.confirmDeletePermanently.description: Failed to delete "{0}" using the Trash. Do you want to permanently delete instead?
workspace.confirmDeletePermanently.solution: You can disable the use of Trash in the preferences.
workspace.confirmDeletePermanently.title: Error deleting file
workspace.confirmMessage.delete: Do you really want to delete the following files?
workspace.confirmMessage.dirtyMultiple: Do you really want to delete {0} files with unsaved changes?
workspace.confirmMessage.dirtySingle: Do you really want to delete {0} with unsaved changes?
workspace.confirmMessage.uriMultiple: Do you really want to delete all the {0} selected files?
workspace.confirmMessage.uriSingle: Do you really want to delete {0}?
workspace.failSaveAs: Cannot run "{0}" for the current widget.
workspace.noErasure: Note: Nothing will be erased from disk
workspace.openRecentPlaceholder: Type the name of the workspace you want to open
workspace.preserveWindow: Enable opening workspaces in current window.
workspace.removeFolder: Are you sure you want to remove the following folder from the workspace?
workspace.removeFolders: Are you sure you want to remove the following folders from the workspace?
workspace.trustEmptyWindow: Controls whether or not the empty workspace is trusted by default.
workspace.trustEnabled: Controls whether or not workspace trust is enabled. If disabled, all workspaces are trusted.
workspace.trustRequest: An extension requests workspace trust but the corresponding API is not yet fully supported. Do you want to trust this workspace?
workspace.untitled-cleanup: There appear to be many untitled workspace files. Please check {0} and remove any unused files.
workspace.workspaceFolderAdded: A workspace with multiple roots was created. Do you want to save your workspace configuration as a file?
